books.title: Tarzan, Lord of the Jungle
books.author: Edgar Rice Burroughs
books.summary: Journeys, times, and cultures collide as two expeditions seek the riches of known and fabeled lands.

books.title: The Scarlet Pimpernel
books.author: Baroness Orczy
books.summary: A daring Englishman with a secret identity rescues French aristocrats from the guillotine during the French Revolution.

books.title: The Education of Henry Adams
books.author: Henry Adams
books.summary: A prominent and caustic historian reflects on the reasons that “the more he was educated, the less he understood,” and what he believes the future holds for American society.

books.title: Eminent Victorians
books.author: Lytton Strachey
books.summary: Four witty and biting biographies of Victorians that take aim at the moral superiority of their subject’s time.

books.title: The House at Pooh Corner
books.author: A. A. Milne
books.summary: A stuffed bear goes on adventures in the woods with his friends.

books.title: Twelfth Night
books.author: William Shakespeare
books.summary: A woman disguises herself as a man and becomes entangled in the courtship of two aristocrats.

books.title: The Importance of Being Earnest
books.author: Oscar Wilde
books.summary: A comedy skewering Victorian high society.

books.title: The Roots of the Mountains
books.author: William Morris
books.summary: The peoples of the dales and woods must unite to defeat a foe intent on enslaving them.

books.title: The Last Post
books.author: Ford Madox Ford
books.summary: An invalid and his family reflect on recent events in the years after the close of the Great War.

books.title: John Silence Stories
books.author: Algernon Blackwood
books.summary: A physician turned detective uses his psychic abilities to solve the strange cases presented to him.

books.title: Up from Slavery
books.author: Booker T. Washington
books.summary: The autobiography of Booker T. Washington, former slave and founder of the Tuskegee Institute.

books.title: The Crimson Circle
books.author: Edgar Wallace
books.summary: A police inspector and an unusual private detective investigate a devious blackmail plot.

books.title: Democracy and Social Ethics
books.author: Jane Addams
books.summary: Jane Addams argues that addressing social issues like poverty and inequality requires shifting from individual morality to a collective understanding of social responsibility.

books.title: Demian
books.author: Hermann Hesse
books.summary: A boy goes on a journey of spiritual growth.

books.title: Nonsense Books
books.author: Edward Lear
books.summary: A collection of literary nonsense in the forms of limericks, songs, and short stories.

books.title: Those Barren Leaves
books.author: Aldous Huxley
books.summary: An aristocrat summons a group of “intelligentsia” to vacation in her Italian mansion.

books.title: Beyond Thirty
books.author: Edgar Rice Burroughs
books.summary: A young naval officer finds himself in a forbidden part of the world after storms waylay his ship.

books.title: Irish Fairy Tales
books.author: James Stephens
books.summary: Ten stories from the Fenian cycle of Irish folklore retold by James Stephens.

books.title: Polynesian Mythology
books.author: George Grey
books.summary: A collection of Māori mythology covering the start of the universe through to the spread of Māori tribes through New Zealand’s North Island.

books.title: Roughing It
books.author: Mark Twain
books.summary: Mark Twain’s semiautobiographical account of his travel across the United States.
